title: How could big tech stocks perform in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: They could go up, or down, or sideways (overall; net change from Jan 1 to Dec 31). And along the way they might do all kinds of swings. Assuming you want to know what I think will in fact happen…I’m very bullish re: 2020 stock market performance in general. But careful, the year is likely to start with a 2–4 week sideways/down market (a minor 4 wave), then after a minor 5 up to new all time highs, a larger intermediate 4, then after an intermediate 5 up to new highs…a PRIMARY 4 back down, then a primary 5 back up again (though somewhere along the line the calendar will swing into 2021). So larger and large moves up, and corrections back down is what I expect. But overall…all indications I’m aware of scream “bull market”.

response.answer_text: Tech stocks are at all time high in 2020 because the huge number of people are working from home. A tech bubble is inflating, will it blow up. Apple, microsoft, google… That's bad news when you consider these five tech companies are collectively worth nearly $6 trillion -- about 25% of the S&P 500's overall value. It means just a handful of stocks can sway the broader market, and all the passive index funds that many investors own.
